From? W.G. Harley, Director, Region III
Date: December 12, 1958
Re: Region III Convention
I am appointing you gentlemen to the general arrangements committee
for the convention* Frankly, I had hoped to hold off on setting
things up in advnace of my successor1s election, but the time is
growing too short to hold off any longer. So this is something
to throw into the hopper to get us started
First, let me fill you In on what* s already set up.
Date: Feb. 19-20
Place: Michigan State University, East Lansing
Housing: Kellogg Center; Meetings: Union Building
In Charge of Local arrangements: Larry Frymire
Housekeeping:
We will be housed in the Kellogg Center, but due to unavailability
of meeting rooms on these dates w© will need to hold the sessions in
the Union Building nearby. We will also have our meals In the Union
(other than breakfast and the banquet). Tentative plans have been
made to hold a modest banquet In the Kellogg Center on the 20th.
Kellogg Center has ample accommodations on the 19tli and 20th but, it
can not house a large number who might ■tfirish to come the night of the
18th. It has 10 double rooms at the Center for ladles and can put
up the men in adjacent dormitories.
X suggest we arrange the program to run from the afternoon through
the following evening and In that t*ay most' people can travel to East
Lansing during the rmorning and afternoon of the 19th. Schedule might
run something like this:
Feb. 19 b* OOpm-4.: 30 Registration
4:30 - Coffee Hour - Get acquainted session
8:00 - First Conference Session
Feb. 20 9:00am-12:00 Morning Sessions
2:00pm-4:30 Afternoon Sessions
6:30 pm Dinner - Speaker
Finances: Headquarters has agreed to make available $400 tpvyard the
coast of a regional meeting. (Available funds must be divided among
three regions.) This amount Is not large enough to go very far and
certainly some §25-450 will need to be held out to cover adminstrative
and incidental expenses.
There would seem to be these possibilities. Apply the money toward:
1. Expences of participants, probably limited to those coming from
beyond a 50 mile radius and paid as a flat fee or on the basis of
total miles traveled.
